long_description: If pseudorandom functions exist, then pseudorandom permutations exist.  Starting with a PRF $G : \{0,1\}^n \rightarrow \{0,1\}^{n}$.  We can construct a PRP $F : \{0,1\}^n \cross {0,1\}^s \rightarrow \{0,1\}^{n}$.  Specifically, doing three rounds of a Feistel network (originally \cite{feistel1973cryptography}, explained more fully in \cite{schneier1996unbalanced}) with a PRF as the round function will yield a PRP.
